comment: The class content was very unorganized and confusing. She had a lot of difficulties with technology. There were random pop-up quizzes during the class that was timed. The assignments were not always posted on time as stated. Not very helpful and understanding to students with learning disabilities or willing to help or encourage their success.

Dr. Z is great. Some questions on the tests can be "trick questions" but overall she is a very nice, well educated lady and I feel I learned a lot from her and this course. Lectures are interesting and she brings real life experience to the conversation. Her stories keep you intrigued and help you remember the information taught.

Make sure you go to class, or get the notes from some one! Her test are over what she talks about. Take your camera or phone and take pictures of the slides because she might go fast, and doesn't post them for you. She's very nice and will help you if you ask her for help.
She is easy. Take her! but chose to do the Aids paper, and beware she is very opinionated and will talk about them a lot!

Dr. Z. is a very knowledgeable professor.  She is always willing to help and encourages you to participate in her class.  Her exams are very easy (usually from PPTS) but the book is helpful for reviewing.  She is very nice and yes sometimes expresses her own beliefs, but certainly DOES NOT impose them. I definitely recommend her.

Class is exceptionally easy. The tests are straight from the notes. Chose the AIDS seminar for the paper. Worth the A that is handed to you. The only problem is that she will shove her ideas about how to raise your children down your throat every class period. By the end of the semester I ended up hating her.

Don't listen to people who say she tries to press her liberal beliefs on her students. She doesn't do that AT ALL. She does mention her beliefs from time to time, but I never saw her pick favorites based on students' beliefs. I love Dr. Z. Every psych major should take her at least once. She is funny, laid-back, and very knowledgeable.

I am sure there are better profs on campus, but Dr. Z is great. I had an emergency and was late to an exam and she was very helpful. She can be a little condescending when answering questions, but you'd really have to try NOT to pass this class. Only 3 exams and a paper. Exams were a bit challenging, but I'd recommend her.

I was a little afraid of her before I took the class, but I really liked her class and her way of teaching. Its all lecture, but she breaks it up with first hand stories. Class attendance is not mandatory, but tests are from lectures, not the book. I hope to take her for future classes.

Ms. Ziegler is an awful teacher. Her lectures are extremely boring and her power points do not helps at all. especially since she goes way too fast through them and you dont get half of the notes anyways. do not take her if you have a choice. There's other teachers that are better at teaching this course.and her voice is like nails on a chalk board

Why is everyone afraid of Dr. Z? She's very helpful if you simply ASK. She's always good for a debate, but doesn't necessarily have to be right. Her class is thorough and prepares you for the real world/grad school, but I've definitely had harder at KSU. Suck it up and stay on her good side. She's really quite fun, and awesome at writing references

Dr.Z is not a difficult prof follow the syllabus and study guide for each test ,attend class and write notes. For the test, understand each question and relate it to the covered topics.Do not memorize you will fail!!!

Attendance is not maditory but lecture material is vital for exams. You can read the book but it does not help much. Dr. Z disagrees with a lot of text content. Gives out study guides for each exam but it does not mean thats what will be on the test. Adds and takes off things without telling you. Paper is easy, Aids workshop recommended.

Took Family Interaction over the summer. Very good class & good professor. I really enjoyed it. It was challenging at times, but the tests were straightforward and clear. I do wish she had posted power points though, and not crammed a thousand words onto one slide. That was a little frustrating. Otherwise, great.
go to class, pay attention, will do fine. tests are application but if you understand the concept easy to answer questions. willing to help whenever she can.

Class is pretty normal but don't disagree with her or you won't recover from her retaliatory grading. If you keep your head down and agree when appropriate then you should be able to make it through her class.

I loved Dr. Z! Powerpoints were used for notes and were very long but if you listen to her and write down the correct things you can do well. I would suggest reading each chapter as well. She gives study guides, only one paper and about 3 or 4 tests. Very interesting class and she will answer any and all questions. I would take her again!

Dr. Z covers so much material for each section, it can get frustrating especially when it comes to test time.  Expect to take 30+ page notes for each section.  She can get impatient with you if you ask her to slow down on the ppt.  She knows her stuff but I think she needs to cover just the main points and not every little detail.

not my most favorite teacher. Hard to study for her tests. she gives you an outline but all questions are application, not really study-able. Go to class, b/c a lot of her questions come from her discussions. Gotta do one 4 page paper, which she limits cause she doesn't want to have to read a lot. She's not too boring in class though.
I thought she was very helpful and funny. I don't think she likes suck ups though, so don't even try...
Great professor!!! Difficult but very fair and helpful. A must take professor if planning to attend Grad. school. You will defintely be prepared. Very interesting and funny.
She is a fun teacher. I would surely take another class with her.
A good instructor, hard but she gives very clear guidelines for the students to
